title: 1 Peter Chapter 4 Quiz - Multi-Level
description: An enhanced quiz on 1 Peter chapter 4 with Easy, Medium, Hard, and Theological levels. Each level has 15 carefully crafted questions. Choose your difficulty and dive in!

easy.title: 1 Peter Chapter 4 Quiz - Easy Level
easy.description: Perfect for beginners! Test your basic knowledge of 1 Peter Chapter 4.

questions.question: According to 1 Peter 4:1, what should we arm ourselves with?
options: The same mind as Christ who suffered in the flesh
The spirit of wisdom and understanding
questions.correctAnswer: The same mind as Christ who suffered in the flesh
questions.explanation: 1 Peter 4:1 instructs believers to arm themselves with the same mind as Christ who suffered in the flesh.

questions.question: What is the purpose of no longer living the rest of our time in the flesh, according to 1 Peter 4:2?
options: To live to the will of God
To seek pleasures of the flesh
questions.correctAnswer: To live to the will of God
questions.explanation: 1 Peter 4:2 says we should no longer live to the lusts of men but to the will of God.

questions.question: What did the past life of believers consist of, according to 1 Peter 4:3?
options: Lasciviousness, lusts, excess of wine, revellings, banquetings, and abominable idolatries
questions.correctAnswer: Lasciviousness, lusts, excess of wine, revellings, banquetings, and abominable idolatries
questions.explanation: 1 Peter 4:3 describes the past life as full of sinful behaviors like lasciviousness and idolatries.

questions.question: According to 1 Peter 4:4, how do others react when believers do not run with them in the same excess of riot?
options: They think it strange and speak evil of believers
They join the believers in prayer
questions.correctAnswer: They think it strange and speak evil of believers
questions.explanation: 1 Peter 4:4 states that others think it strange and speak evil of believers when they do not join in excess.

questions.question: Who will give account according to 1 Peter 4:5?
options: He that is ready to judge the quick and the dead
questions.correctAnswer: He that is ready to judge the quick and the dead
questions.explanation: 1 Peter 4:5 declares that everyone will give account to the one ready to judge both the living and the dead.

questions.question: True or False: According to 1 Peter 4:7, believers are instructed to be sober and watch unto prayer.
questions.correctAnswer: True
questions.explanation: 1 Peter 4:7 commands believers to be sober and watch unto prayer because the end of all things is at hand.

questions.question: According to 1 Peter 4:8, what covers the multitude of sins?
questions.correctAnswer: Fervent charity
questions.explanation: 1 Peter 4:8 teaches that above all things, fervent charity among believers shall cover the multitude of sins.

questions.question: How should hospitality be used according to 1 Peter 4:9?
questions.correctAnswer: Without grudging
questions.explanation: 1 Peter 4:9 instructs believers to use hospitality one to another without grudging.

questions.question: What does 1 Peter 4:10 say about the gifts received by each man?
options: Minister the same one to another as good stewards of the manifold grace of God
Hide the gifts to avoid jealousy
Use gifts only for personal gain
Give gifts to the wealthy only
questions.correctAnswer: Minister the same one to another as good stewards of the manifold grace of God
questions.explanation: 1 Peter 4:10 encourages believers to use their gifts to serve one another as good stewards of God's grace.

questions.question: Complete this verse from 1 Peter 4:11: 'If any man speak, let him speak as the ______ of God.'
questions.correctAnswer: oracles
questions.explanation: 1 Peter 4:11 says, 'If any man speak, let him speak as the oracles of God,' highlighting the importance of speaking God's truth.

questions.question: True or False: 1 Peter 4:12 tells believers to think it strange when they face fiery trials.
questions.correctAnswer: False
questions.explanation: 1 Peter 4:12 instructs believers not to think it strange concerning fiery trials, as if something unusual was happening.

questions.question: According to 1 Peter 4:13, believers should rejoice because they are partakers of whose sufferings?
questions.correctAnswer: Christ's sufferings
questions.explanation: 1 Peter 4:13 encourages believers to rejoice as they share in Christ's sufferings.

questions.question: According to 1 Peter 4:14, what rests upon those who are reproached for the name of Christ?
options: The spirit of glory and of God
questions.correctAnswer: The spirit of glory and of God
questions.explanation: 1 Peter 4:14 states that the spirit of glory and of God rests upon those reproached for Christ's name.

questions.question: Who should not suffer according to 1 Peter 4:15?
questions.correctAnswer: Murderers, thieves, evildoers, and busybodies
questions.explanation: 1 Peter 4:15 warns that no one should suffer as a murderer, thief, evildoer, or busybody in other men's matters.

questions.question: True or False: 1 Peter 4:16 advises that if anyone suffers as a Christian, they should be ashamed.
questions.correctAnswer: False
questions.explanation: 1 Peter 4:16 teaches that if anyone suffers as a Christian, they should not be ashamed but glorify God.

medium.title: 1 Peter Chapter 4 Quiz - Medium Level
medium.description: Ready for more? Apply biblical truths from 1 Peter Chapter 4 to real-life situations.

questions.question: How does 1 Peter 4:1 teach us about dealing with suffering and sin?
options: Suffering in the flesh leads to ceasing from sin
Suffering should be avoided at all costs
questions.correctAnswer: Suffering in the flesh leads to ceasing from sin
questions.explanation: 1 Peter 4:1 encourages believers to arm themselves with the same mind as Christ, who suffered in the flesh and thereby ceased from sin. This teaches that suffering can lead to spiritual growth and victory over sin, supported by verses 1 Peter 4:2-3 which contrast living for lusts versus living for God's will.

questions.question: According to 1 Peter 4:7, what spiritual disciplines should Christians practice because the end of all things is at hand?
options: Be sober and watch unto prayer
questions.correctAnswer: Be sober and watch unto prayer
questions.explanation: 1 Peter 4:7 commands believers to be sober and watch unto prayer in light of the nearness of the end. This emphasizes self-control and vigilance in prayer as vital spiritual disciplines, which relate to humility and perseverance (see also verses 8-9 on love and hospitality).

questions.question: What does 1 Peter 4:8 teach about love among believers?
options: Charity covers the multitude of sins
Love is unimportant compared to knowledge
Love should be shown only to friends
Charity is optional in Christian life
questions.correctAnswer: Charity covers the multitude of sins
questions.explanation: 1 Peter 4:8 emphasizes fervent charity (love) among believers, teaching that love can cover many sins. This encourages forgiveness and reconciliation within the Christian community, supporting practical Christian living and humility.

questions.question: How should Christians use their gifts, according to 1 Peter 4:10?
options: As good stewards of the manifold grace of God
To gain personal fame and wealth
To impress others with their talents
Only when asked by church leaders
questions.correctAnswer: As good stewards of the manifold grace of God
questions.explanation: 1 Peter 4:10 teaches that every believer should minister the gifts they have received to one another as faithful stewards of God’s grace. This underscores stewardship, generosity, and service in church life, promoting integrity and humility.

questions.question: What attitude should Christians have when they suffer for being a Christian, based on 1 Peter 4:16?
options: Do not be ashamed but glorify God
Hide their faith to avoid shame
questions.correctAnswer: Do not be ashamed but glorify God
questions.explanation: 1 Peter 4:16 instructs believers not to be ashamed if they suffer as Christians but to glorify God instead. This teaches perseverance and faithfulness under trial, supported by verses 4:12-14 which encourage rejoicing in sufferings and trusting God’s glory.

questions.question: According to 1 Peter 4:9, how should Christians practice hospitality?
options: Only to those who can repay
questions.correctAnswer: Without grudging
questions.explanation: 1 Peter 4:9 commands believers to use hospitality one to another without grudging, promoting generosity and love within the Christian community. This reflects humility and the practical outworking of charity as taught in verses 4:7-8.

questions.question: What is the significance of judgment beginning at the house of God, according to 1 Peter 4:17?
options: Believers will be judged first to encourage holiness
questions.correctAnswer: Believers will be judged first to encourage holiness
questions.explanation: 1 Peter 4:17 explains that judgment begins at the house of God, meaning believers face testing first, which underscores the call to holiness and obedience to the gospel. This encourages integrity and faithfulness in daily life (see verses 4:18-19).

questions.question: True or False: 1 Peter 4:15 allows believers to suffer as murderers or thieves.
questions.correctAnswer: False
questions.explanation: 1 Peter 4:15 explicitly states that no one should suffer as a murderer, thief, evildoer, or busybody, emphasizing that suffering must be for righteousness, not wrongdoing.

questions.question: True or False: According to 1 Peter 4:14, being reproached for Christ is a cause for happiness.
questions.correctAnswer: True
questions.explanation: 1 Peter 4:14 teaches that if believers are reproached for the name of Christ, they are happy because the Spirit of glory and of God rests upon them, linking suffering with divine approval.

questions.question: A believer is struggling with judging others who do not follow the gospel. Based on 1 Peter 4:5 and 4:17, what biblical truth would you share?
options: God will judge both the living and the dead, beginning with His church
We must judge others quickly to protect the church
Only the church leaders will be judged
questions.correctAnswer: God will judge both the living and the dead, beginning with His church
questions.explanation: 1 Peter 4:5 reminds that everyone must give account to God who judges the living and the dead, and 4:17 states judgment begins at the house of God, highlighting that all will face God's righteous judgment and encouraging humility and obedience.

questions.question: How does 1 Peter 4:13 encourage believers facing trials?
options: Rejoice as partakers of Christ's sufferings to share in His future glory
Ignore suffering and focus on wealth
Feel discouraged because trials are punishment
questions.correctAnswer: Rejoice as partakers of Christ's sufferings to share in His future glory
questions.explanation: 1 Peter 4:13 calls believers to rejoice in suffering because they participate in Christ’s sufferings and will share His glory, teaching perseverance and hope grounded in faith.

questions.question: Fill in the blank: 1 Peter 4:19 instructs those who suffer according to the will of God to commit the keeping of their souls to Him in __________.
questions.correctAnswer: well doing
questions.explanation: 1 Peter 4:19 encourages believers suffering according to God's will to entrust their souls to Him while continuing to do good works, reflecting trust and obedience in trials.

questions.question: How does 1 Peter 4:11 guide believers in their speech and service?
options: Speak as oracles of God and serve with God-given ability to glorify Him
Speak freely without concern and serve only when convenient
Use speech to gain popularity and avoid service
Speak only in private and avoid public ministry
questions.correctAnswer: Speak as oracles of God and serve with God-given ability to glorify Him
questions.explanation: 1 Peter 4:11 instructs believers to speak as God’s oracles and serve with the abilities God provides, aiming to glorify God in all things, promoting integrity and humility in ministry.

questions.question: What does 1 Peter 4:6 say about the gospel being preached to the dead?
options: They might be judged in the flesh but live in the spirit
The dead are no longer accountable
The gospel is irrelevant to the dead
The dead are judged only by human standards
questions.correctAnswer: They might be judged in the flesh but live in the spirit
questions.explanation: 1 Peter 4:6 explains the gospel was preached to the dead so they might be judged according to human standards but live spiritually according to God, emphasizing hope beyond physical death.

questions.question: How does 1 Peter 4:2 teach about the focus of a believer's life after repentance?
options: To live according to the will of God, not lusts of men
To follow the desires of the flesh
questions.correctAnswer: To live according to the will of God, not lusts of men
questions.explanation: 1 Peter 4:2 instructs believers to no longer live for the lusts of men but to live for God's will, teaching obedience and faithfulness in daily life after repentance.

hard.title: 1 Peter Chapter 4 Quiz - Hard Level
hard.description: Challenge yourself with deep analysis and cross-biblical connections from 1 Peter Chapter 4.

questions.question: In 1 Peter 4:1, what mindset are believers urged to arm themselves with, and what is its significance in relation to sin?
options: The same mind as Christ who suffered in the flesh, ceasing from sin
A mindset of earthly pleasure and self-indulgence
An attitude of indifference towards suffering
A mindset focused solely on personal success
questions.correctAnswer: The same mind as Christ who suffered in the flesh, ceasing from sin
questions.explanation: 1 Peter 4:1 calls believers to arm themselves with the same mind as Christ who suffered, signifying that suffering in the flesh leads to cessation from sin.

questions.question: According to 1 Peter 4:2, how should believers live the rest of their time in the flesh?
options: Not to the lusts of men, but to the will of God
In pursuit of wealth and power
Engaging in the same excesses as before
questions.correctAnswer: Not to the lusts of men, but to the will of God
questions.explanation: 1 Peter 4:2 instructs believers to live no longer for human desires but according to God's will, highlighting a transformation in lifestyle.

questions.question: What practices characterized the former life of believers before their conversion as described in 1 Peter 4:3?
options: Lasciviousness, lusts, excess of wine, revellings, banquetings, and abominable idolatries
Strict adherence to the Mosaic Law
questions.correctAnswer: Lasciviousness, lusts, excess of wine, revellings, banquetings, and abominable idolatries
questions.explanation: 1 Peter 4:3 lists these sinful behaviors as part of the past life before embracing Christ.

questions.question: In 1 Peter 4:4, what is the reaction of others to believers who do not join in their excesses?
options: They think it strange and speak evil of them
They invite them to join more moderate activities
questions.correctAnswer: They think it strange and speak evil of them
questions.explanation: The verse describes how unbelievers find it strange that believers do not participate and consequently speak evil against them.

questions.question: Who is the one to whom all must give account according to 1 Peter 4:5?
options: Him that is ready to judge the quick and the dead
questions.correctAnswer: Him that is ready to judge the quick and the dead
questions.explanation: 1 Peter 4:5 highlights that God, who judges both the living and the dead, is the ultimate authority to whom everyone must give account.

questions.question: According to 1 Peter 4:6, why was the gospel preached to those who are dead?
options: That they might be judged according to men in the flesh, but live according to God in the spirit
To condemn them without hope of salvation
questions.correctAnswer: That they might be judged according to men in the flesh, but live according to God in the spirit
questions.explanation: The gospel was preached so that, though judged by human standards, they could live spiritually with God as explained in 1 Peter 4:6.

questions.question: What exhortation does 1 Peter 4:7 give about the attitude believers should have as the end of all things approaches?
options: Be sober and watch unto prayer
Ignore the future and live for today
questions.correctAnswer: Be sober and watch unto prayer
questions.explanation: 1 Peter 4:7 admonishes believers to be sober-minded and vigilant in prayer as the end times draw near.

questions.question: In 1 Peter 4:8, what is said to cover a multitude of sins, and what is the significance of this in the context of community life?
questions.correctAnswer: Fervent charity (love)
questions.explanation: The verse declares that fervent love among believers covers many sins, emphasizing forgiveness and unity within the community.

questions.question: How does 1 Peter 4:10 instruct believers to use their spiritual gifts?
options: As good stewards of the manifold grace of God, ministering to one another
questions.correctAnswer: As good stewards of the manifold grace of God, ministering to one another
questions.explanation: Believers are called to use their gifts responsibly to serve each other, reflecting God's grace, as stated in 1 Peter 4:10.

questions.question: What does 1 Peter 4:11 say about those who speak or minister among believers?
options: They should do so as the oracles of God and by God's ability, to glorify Him
They should seek personal glory first
Their words and deeds are secondary to their intentions
questions.correctAnswer: They should do so as the oracles of God and by God's ability, to glorify Him
questions.explanation: The verse teaches that speech and service should be God-centered and empowered by Him for His glory.

questions.question: True or False: According to 1 Peter 4:12, believers should be surprised when they face fiery trials.
questions.correctAnswer: False
questions.explanation: 1 Peter 4:12 advises believers not to think it strange when they encounter fiery trials, implying such suffering is expected.

questions.question: What attitude does 1 Peter 4:13 encourage believers to have in relation to sharing Christ's sufferings?
options: Rejoice, so they may be glad with exceeding joy when His glory is revealed
questions.correctAnswer: Rejoice, so they may be glad with exceeding joy when His glory is revealed
questions.explanation: Believers are encouraged to rejoice in suffering with Christ, anticipating future glory as per 1 Peter 4:13.

questions.question: According to 1 Peter 4:14, what rests upon those who are reproached for the name of Christ?
options: The spirit of glory and of God
questions.correctAnswer: The spirit of glory and of God
questions.explanation: The verse promises that those reproached for Christ have the spirit of glory and God resting upon them.

questions.question: Which types of suffering does 1 Peter 4:15 warn believers not to suffer as?
options: As a murderer, thief, evildoer, or busybody
questions.correctAnswer: As a murderer, thief, evildoer, or busybody
questions.explanation: The verse differentiates suffering for sin from suffering as a Christian, warning against suffering for wrongful acts.

questions.question: What does 1 Peter 4:16 instruct those who suffer as Christians to do?
options: Not to be ashamed but to glorify God
Hide their faith to avoid persecution
questions.correctAnswer: Not to be ashamed but to glorify God
questions.explanation: Believers suffering for Christ are encouraged to glorify God rather than feel shame, emphasizing faithfulness.

theological.title: 1 Peter Chapter 4 Quiz - Theological Level
theological.description: Deep biblical theology from 1 Peter Chapter 4 that unites all believers. Explore foundational truths about God, creation, and humanity.

questions.question: According to 1 Peter 4:1, what is the effect of suffering in the flesh as Christ did?
questions.correctAnswer: Ceases from sin
questions.explanation: 1 Peter 4:1 teaches that suffering in the flesh like Christ results in ceasing from sin. This aligns with Romans 6:6 where believers are dead to sin, and with Hebrews 12:3 which encourages endurance in suffering. Isaiah 53:5 speaks of Christ's suffering for our healing, and 2 Timothy 2:3 calls believers to share in suffering for righteousness.

questions.question: In 1 Peter 4:2, what should a believer no longer live for?
questions.correctAnswer: The lusts of men
questions.explanation: 1 Peter 4:2 instructs believers not to live the rest of their earthly time to the lusts of men but to the will of God. This corresponds with Galatians 5:16-17 on walking by the Spirit instead of fleshly desires, and with Romans 8:13 which calls for living by the Spirit rather than sinful passions. Psalm 119:36 encourages turning away from sinful desires, and Titus 2:11-12 teaches living soberly and righteously.

questions.question: Which of the following behaviors does 1 Peter 4:3 mention as part of the former life of Gentiles?
options: Lasciviousness, excess of wine, and abominable idolatries
questions.correctAnswer: Lasciviousness, excess of wine, and abominable idolatries
questions.explanation: 1 Peter 4:3 lists lasciviousness, lusts, excess of wine, revellings, banquetings, and abominable idolatries as part of the Gentiles' past life. This contrasts with Ephesians 5:18 which warns against drunkenness, and Romans 13:13 which calls for reverent living. Exodus 20:3-5 condemns idolatry, and Galatians 5:19-21 lists acts of the flesh including sensuality and drunkenness.

questions.question: According to 1 Peter 4:5, to whom must every person give account?
options: Him who is ready to judge the quick and the dead
questions.correctAnswer: Him who is ready to judge the quick and the dead
questions.explanation: 1 Peter 4:5 states that everyone must give account to Him who is ready to judge the living ('quick') and the dead. This is consistent with Hebrews 9:27 which declares judgment after death, Romans 14:12 on giving account to God, Matthew 25:31-46 describing final judgment, and Ecclesiastes 12:14 which says God will bring every deed into judgment.

questions.question: What is the purpose of the gospel being preached to the dead, according to 1 Peter 4:6?
options: That they might be judged according to men in the flesh but live according to God in the spirit
That they might be resurrected immediately
That they might return to earthly life
That they might receive earthly blessings
questions.correctAnswer: That they might be judged according to men in the flesh but live according to God in the spirit
questions.explanation: 1 Peter 4:6 explains the gospel was preached to the dead so they might be judged according to men in the flesh but live according to God in the spirit. This reflects John 5:24 about passing from death to life through hearing Christ's word, Ezekiel 37's vision of dry bones revived by God's spirit, and Romans 8:11 speaking of the Spirit giving life to mortal bodies. Isaiah 26:19 also promises resurrection and life through God's word.

questions.question: What exhortation does 1 Peter 4:7 give concerning the end of all things?
options: Be sober and watch unto prayer
questions.correctAnswer: Be sober and watch unto prayer
questions.explanation: 1 Peter 4:7 urges believers to be sober and watch unto prayer because the end of all things is near. This aligns with 1 Thessalonians 5:6-8 on being alert and sober, Ephesians 6:18's call to pray always, Mark 13:33’s watchfulness for Christ’s return, and Luke 21:36 encouraging prayer for strength to endure the end times.

questions.question: According to 1 Peter 4:8, what does fervent charity accomplish?
questions.correctAnswer: Covers the multitude of sins
questions.explanation: 1 Peter 4:8 states that fervent charity covers the multitude of sins. This corresponds to Proverbs 10:12 where love covers all offenses, 1 Corinthians 13 on the supremacy of love, James 5:20 on turning a sinner from error saving a soul, and Colossians 3:14 which says love binds all virtues together in perfect unity.

questions.question: What attitude should believers have when showing hospitality according to 1 Peter 4:9?
questions.correctAnswer: Without grudging
questions.explanation: 1 Peter 4:9 commands believers to use hospitality to one another without grudging. Romans 12:13 also encourages practicing hospitality, Hebrews 13:2 warns of entertaining angels unaware, Matthew 10:42 speaks of rewards for hospitality, and 3 John 1:5 commends hospitality for fellow believers.

questions.question: According to 1 Peter 4:10, how should believers use their spiritual gifts?
options: As good stewards of the manifold grace of God
questions.correctAnswer: As good stewards of the manifold grace of God
questions.explanation: 1 Peter 4:10 commands believers to minister their gifts as good stewards of God's manifold grace. This is consistent with Romans 12:6-8 on using gifts for the body, 1 Corinthians 12 on diverse gifts given by the Spirit, Matthew 25:14-30 parable of talents emphasizing stewardship, and Ephesians 4:11-13 on gifts for equipping the saints.

questions.question: What is the purpose of speaking and ministering as stated in 1 Peter 4:11?
options: That God in all things may be glorified through Jesus Christ
questions.correctAnswer: That God in all things may be glorified through Jesus Christ
questions.explanation: 1 Peter 4:11 declares that speaking and ministering should be done so that God is glorified through Jesus Christ. This is affirmed in Colossians 3:17, 1 Corinthians 10:31, John 15:8 where Jesus says His Father is glorified through believers, and Philippians 2:9-11 revealing every knee will bow to Jesus.

questions.question: According to 1 Peter 4:12, how should believers regard fiery trials?
options: As a sign of God's abandonment
As a reason to abandon faith
questions.correctAnswer: Not as a strange thing
questions.explanation: 1 Peter 4:12 instructs believers not to think it strange when they face fiery trials. This aligns with James 1:2-4 encouraging joy in trials, Romans 5:3-5 on suffering producing perseverance, 2 Corinthians 12:9 where God's power is perfected in weakness, and John 16:33 where Jesus warns of tribulation but commands peace in Him.

questions.question: What is the attitude toward suffering for the name of Christ according to 1 Peter 4:14?
options: Happy, because the Spirit of glory and of God rests upon you
To be avoided at all cost
questions.correctAnswer: Happy, because the Spirit of glory and of God rests upon you
questions.explanation: 1 Peter 4:14 says believers are happy if reproached for Christ’s name because God's Spirit rests upon them. This corresponds with Matthew 5:11-12's blessing on those persecuted for righteousness, Acts 5:41 rejoicing after suffering, Romans 8:16 on the Spirit testifying to our adoption, and John 14:16-17 where the Spirit is the Comforter abiding with believers.

questions.question: According to 1 Peter 4:15, which of the following is NOT a reason one should suffer?
questions.correctAnswer: As a Christian
questions.explanation: 1 Peter 4:15 forbids suffering as a murderer, thief, evildoer, or busybody, but permits suffering as a Christian. This reflects Acts 5:29 on obeying God rather than men, 2 Timothy 3:12 indicating all who desire to live godly will suffer, and Matthew 5:10 on blessedness of those persecuted for righteousness. Hebrews 11 shows faithful believers enduring suffering for faith.

questions.question: What should a Christian do if they suffer as a Christian, according to 1 Peter 4:16?
options: Not be ashamed, but glorify God
questions.correctAnswer: Not be ashamed, but glorify God
questions.explanation: 1 Peter 4:16 encourages those who suffer as Christians not to be ashamed but to glorify God. This is consistent with Philippians 1:29 on suffering for Christ being a grace, 2 Timothy 1:8 urging not to be ashamed of the testimony of the Lord, Romans 8:17 on sharing in Christ's sufferings, and James 1:12 on blessedness of persevering under trial.

questions.question: According to 1 Peter 4:17, where does judgment begin?
options: At the court of earthly rulers
At the end of the world
questions.correctAnswer: At the house of God
questions.explanation: 1 Peter 4:17 states that judgment begins at the house of God. This agrees with Ezekiel 9:6 on judgment starting in the sanctuary, Malachi 3:5 on God judging His people, Hebrews 10:30-31 on God as judge of His church, and Romans 2:5-8 on God’s righteous judgment beginning with those who know His will.
